original: OHLSSON, Johannes, Bankkamrer, Hedemora, f Hedma Idsförs 4/10 93 av nmdeni E O o Anna Jansdtr, gm Linnea Andersson. Weylands prakt sk, Påhlmans hdlsinst. Anst Norrl.bkn o Sthlms hdlsbk 15—17, Jordbr.-bkn 17—20, Sv hdlsbkn sed. 20. Styr.ordf AB Dala mek spisbrödsfabr, AB Säters nya spisbrödsbag, Bernh Hedlunds verkst AB o AB Lingheds skogsind, v. ordf S Dal :s jvgsAB, rev St Långviks grufAB, Skand grufAB o Syst.AB i Hedma. Stdflm sed. 22, ordf dräts.kamm sed. 31, ordf el led i fi utredn- o a komm, rev i Kopp l Brandst.bol. Resor: Tyskl, Österr, Danm, Norge, Finl v öl tillf 20—35. Odd Fellow (Exöm).
translated: OHLSSON, Johannes, Bank Clerk, Hedemora, born in Hedemora Parish on October 4th, 1893, to parents E. O. and Anna Jansdtr, married Linnea Andersson. Educated at Weyland's Vocational School and Pålman's Business Institute. Employed at Norrland Bank and Stockholm Commercial Bank from 1915 to 1917, Agricultural Bank from 1917 to 1920, and Swedish Commercial Bank since 1920. Chairman of the Board of Directors of AB Dala Mechanical Bread Factory, AB Säter's New Bread Bakery, Bernh Hedlund's Workshop AB, and AB Linghed's Forestry Industry; Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors of South Dalarna's Highway Company; Auditor for St Långvik's Mine AB, Skand Mine AB, and Sister AB in Hedemora. City Treasurer since 1922, Chairman of the Treasury Committee since 1931, Chairman and Member of various investigation and assessment committees; Auditor for Copper Mine Fire Insurance Company. Traveled to Germany, Austria, Denmark, Norway, and Finland between 1920 and 1935. Member of Odd Fellow (Exempt).
